threads.com:
/vmg/ is a place to discuss all types of mobile games, including both Android and iOS, phones and tablets. Please note that Nintendo and Sony handhelds are considered consoles, and that threads pertaining to those platforms and their gaming titles should be posted elsewhere.

Does this mean discussion of mobile games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vmg/ is just a separate board specifically focused on mobile games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vmg/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

last_replies.com:
>>1050130
Doesn't really matter at all unless you use materials over what you needed for a new milestone.

>Scenario 1: Use consumable immediately. Lets say its one 24 hr one for easy example
>Push milestone
>Wait 24 hours; because you pushed a new milestone, you're getting the extra from it during the whole day. At the end of the day, you end up with your normal progress + an extra 24 hours worth of the new milestone you hit

>Scenario 2: Wait 24 hours to use your consumable. Lets assume that at the end of that period, with the idle materials gained, you are able to finally push to a new milestone (the same one that you immediately got to in scenario 1)
>Now that you're sitting on the new milestone, you use your 24 hours. You end up with normal progress + 24 hours of the new milestone, the exact same end point as scenario 1

So the best use is to only use what's necessary to get to a new outpost milestone and then immediately get it. If you do not think, or don't know, that you can reach the next milestone with the materials you have, don't use them.

Disco Patch is pretty good, her Ultra Skill is only 2 cost so it builds up fairly quick, and it debuffs the enemy to take more damage. last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1053406
She can't do that, unless you are really overpowered. Mind you I have her, but she's not doing anything. A typical case of a whale toy, really.

>>1053542
You don't need her for the prism fights if you use Seira. She's still doing something similar, but of course if you build an entire party around double enhancing + charge and use Seira you get a 1 turn advantage, as you can't use the SP you gain in turn 3 in turn 3. Though this does require a charge buffer (=Shiki) and Field Enhancer (Tsukasa S, Higuchi alt, Iroha) that can live.
Kozue is much better than Seira in dungeons though, and still extremely good for prisms. Without either Seira or Kozue, or the SP- strategy with TONS of firepower, you will take a much longer time. I think Seira doing prisms a little better (with a lot of help) is just fair, when Kozue is actually not entirely trash in dungeons, and in fact pretty good for your SP upkeep. Saves energy, too.

In gacha you generally tier characters based on how fast they make things and how overall useful a char is. HBR isn't exactly a game with massive difficulty and stats are the most important, though obviously elemental teams a good, yet require whaling or good luck in gacha. This is why everything crit is so awesome -> It makes things die a lot faster. SP recovery is the same. Sure it doesn't do anything if you have nothing else, but that's the same with literally anything.
Calling that trash is just completely wrong. That's like calling batteries in counterside trash, TP boost in pricon trash and so on. Kozue is a battery, just like S Yunyun. That is VERY strong.

Sure, there are cases where she doesn't do anything for you, as there are always specific chars that are simply outstanding in a specific field. Being really good in a lot of fields (other than OD strategies, where for example Seira is also trash), is however still good. I think calling that bad is really really wrong. It's like calling Tama's vanilla SS+S trash.

fast, explosive satellites
melting lava zones, volcanic crater meteors
you basically pick up everything that benefits mana gain, and explosion radius and damage (arcane effuse, gunpowder, energy core, war magic, cauldron etc)
